about_the_game:
LEVEL UP

Recruit one of 3 classes of hero to enter the mountain and collect Foepower from the growing horde of corrupted monsters. Receive dynamic level-up choices, hunt for powerful equipment, and bump into unique encounters offering a fresh and fun level up experience for each playthrough.

Your recruited hero runs go from Level 1 to Level 30, designed for quick in-and-out gameplay. Each round of auto-battling exploration takes 30-90 seconds, with the total run requiring less than 30 minutes. Your run to level 30 is timed during active combat, offering a speed run competition versus your own best performances.

You'll have to balance how careful or aggressive to be, as you balance harvesting Foepower, experience, and loot, versus escaping increasingly difficult monsters and the effects of the mountain's corruption. As you gather more Foepower, you can invest in troupe-wide Foepower traits to strengthen all your heroes.

TEST YOUR CHAMPIONS

At level 30, your heroes compete to become an arena champion. In the arena, you can battle increasingly strong bosses, and gain additional arena level up powers.

You can also test your newest hero versus your best hero of that class (Warrior, Mage, or Inquisitor). Its a king of the hill match - the best wins and can loot an item from the fallen.

Your arena champions can also train new recruits allowing for a type of multi-classing hero, enabling new gameplay variations.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 or 11
  • Processor: 2.0+ Ghz
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 2 GB with OpenGL 3.3+ support
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 or 11
  • Processor: 3.0+ Ghz
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 4 GB with OpenGL 4.6+ support
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
  • Additional Notes: 1080p Display/Window

short_description: Foepower is a roguelite auto-battle RPG with a vintage feel.  Send heroes into the mountain to level up, gear up, and extract the all-important Foepower - because you'll need it to strengthen the next hero!
